discover.name: Sassy Cow Creamery
discover.description: Nestled near Sun Prairie, Wisconsin, Sassy Cow Creamery is a cherished local gem run by the Baerwolf family. This working dairy farm doubles as a cozy farmhouse kitchen, serving fresh, authentic Wisconsin meals and dairy products. Its on-site facility crafts artisanal ice cream and chocolate milk daily using milk from the family’s nearby farms, ensuring every scoop and sip captures the rich, creamy essence of Wisconsin’s dairy heritage.

discover.name: Wisconsin Dells
discover.address: 701 Superior Street, PO Box 390 Wisconsin Dells, WI 53965
discover.description: Wisconsin Dells, less than an hour from Sun Prairie, is the “Waterpark Capital of the World,” blending natural beauty with family-friendly attractions. Nestled along the Wisconsin River, it boasts wetlands, forests, and sandstone formations, alongside world-class water parks, hotels, restaurants, and shopping. Drawing millions yearly, this vibrant Midwest destination offers outdoor adventures, entertainment, and relaxation, catering to families, thrill-seekers, and nature lovers with its diverse, year-round appeal.

discover.name: Wisconsin State Capitol
discover.description: The Wisconsin State Capitol, a Beaux-Arts masterpiece, stands proudly in downtown Madison’s Capitol Square. Completed in 1917, its white granite exterior, intricate interior, and towering dome define the city’s skyline. Housing the state’s legislative chambers, governor’s office, and Supreme Court, it’s a hub of political activity. This architectural gem, symbolizing civic pride, welcomes visitors from Wisconsin and beyond, showcasing its stunning design and historical significance.

discover.name: University of Wisconsin, Madison
discover.description: The University of Wisconsin–Madison, located in vibrant Madison, Wisconsin, is a premier public research university celebrated for academic excellence, innovative research, and public service. Founded in 1848 as Wisconsin gained statehood, UW–Madison is the state’s official university and flagship of the University of Wisconsin System. As the first public university in Wisconsin, it has evolved into a national leader in higher education and intellectual discovery.

discover.name: Wisconsin History Society
discover.description: The Wisconsin Historical Society, based in Madison, Wisconsin, is a leading institution preserving one of the nation’s largest historical archives, with over 290 million items. Its vast collection includes rare manuscripts, photographs, maps, newspapers, government records, diaries, oral histories, and artifacts. Documenting Wisconsin’s indigenous heritage, settlement, industrial growth, and cultural evolution, this invaluable resource serves historians, researchers, educators, and the public, narrating the state’s rich history and national contributions.

discover.name: Wisconsin Veterans Museum
discover.description: The Wisconsin Veterans Museum in Madison, Wisconsin, an outreach program of the Wisconsin Department of Veterans Affairs, honors and preserves the stories of Wisconsin veterans who served in the U.S. armed forces across eras. As a tribute to their sacrifices, it highlights their role in shaping Wisconsin’s military heritage and the nation’s history. Through engaging exhibits, the museum fosters a deeper understanding of veterans’ experiences and the impact of military service.

discover.name: Sun Prairie Farmer's Market
discover.description: The Sun Prairie Farmers’ Market, held year-round in downtown Sun Prairie, Wisconsin, connects local farmers and artisans with customers. Vendors offer fresh produce, beef, pork, eggs, honey, plants, and handmade crafts like jewelry, pottery, candles, and soaps. The outdoor market runs Saturdays, May 3 to October 25, 2025, from 7 AM to 12 PM at Cannery Square and Market Street. The indoor winter market operates November 8, 2025, to April 11, 2026 (excluding December 27), from 9 AM to 12 PM at the Westside Community Services Building, 2598 West Main Street.

discover.name: Dream Park
discover.description: Dream Park in Sun Prairie, Wisconsin, is celebrated for its expansive, engaging playground, a family favorite. Designed with diverse play structures, it sparks imaginative play and physical activity for kids of all ages. The spacious, well-equipped area offers ample room for exploration and fun, creating a vibrant community hub where families connect and enjoy quality time together, making it a cherished destination for both locals and visitors.
